text: Chorleywood is a village and a civil parish in the Three Rivers District, Hertfordshire. It used to be part of the parish of Rickmansworth. 11,286 people lived there at the 2011 census. In 2004 a study by the University of Oxford said Chorleywood was the “happiest place” to live in the UK. In 2011 it was said to be the “least deprived” area in the country by the Department of Communities and Local Government. ==References== Category:Villages in Hertfordshire Category:Civil parishes in Hertfordshire
title: Chorleywood
